title: 0.3 Update sitemap.ts to include service pages
description:
## Task: Update Sitemap with Service Pages

### File: `src/app/sitemap.ts`

### Current State
Sitemap includes static pages and blog posts but NOT the /services/* pSEO pages.

### Changes Required

Add dynamic service pages:
```typescript
import { getPublishedPages } from '@/data/pseo';

// In sitemap function:
const servicePages = getPublishedPages().map((page) => ({
  url: `https://alexmayhew.dev/services/${page.slug}`,
  lastModified: page.lastUpdated,
  changeFrequency: 'monthly' as const,
  priority: 0.9,
}));

// Merge with existing pages
return [...staticPages, ...blogPages, ...servicePages];
```

### Priority Settings
- Homepage: 1.0
- Services Hub: 0.95
- Service Pages: 0.9
- Blog Posts: 0.7
- Utility Pages: 0.3

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All 5+ service pages appear in sitemap
- [ ] Sitemap validates at /sitemap.xml
- [ ] lastModified dates accurate
- [ ] No duplicate URLs

title: 0.4 Enhance JSON-LD schema for Technical Advisor positioning
description:
## Task: Update JSON-LD Schema

### File: `src/components/seo/json-ld.tsx`

### Current Issues
- jobTitle: "Full-Stack Developer" (should be "Technical Advisor")
- worksFor.name: "Freelance" (should be "Alex Mayhew Consulting")
- knowsAbout: Generic list (needs expansion)

### Changes Required

**1. Person Schema Updates**
```typescript
const personSchema = {
  "@type": "Person",
  name: "Alex Mayhew",
  jobTitle: "Technical Advisor & Systems Architect",
  worksFor: {
    "@type": "Organization",
    name: "Alex Mayhew Consulting",
  },
  knowsAbout: [
    // Core Technologies
    "Next.js", "React", "TypeScript", "Node.js", "Python",
    "PostgreSQL", "Redis", "GraphQL", "REST APIs",
    // Infrastructure
    "AWS", "Cloudflare Workers", "Docker", "Kubernetes",
    "Edge Computing", "Serverless Architecture",
    // Specializations
    "System Architecture", "Performance Optimization",
    "Legacy Migration", "AI/ML Integration",
    "Core Web Vitals", "SaaS Development",
    // Domains
    "Fintech Development", "Healthcare Technology",
    "E-commerce Platforms", "B2B SaaS"
  ],
  // Add achievements
  award: [
    "337x performance improvement - TraceForge vectorization engine",
    "73% cost reduction - PhotoKeep Pro AI restoration"
  ],
  sameAs: [
    "https://github.com/LecoMV",
    "https://www.linkedin.com/in/alexmmayhew",
    "https://x.com/alexmayhewdev",
    "https://bsky.app/profile/alexmayhewdev.bsky.social"
  ]
};
```

**2. ProfessionalService Updates**
- Change name to "Alex Mayhew - Technical Advisory Services"
- Add service tiers to hasOfferCatalog
- Add aggregateRating if testimonials available

**3. Add BreadcrumbList Schema**
For service pages navigation.

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All schemas validate in Google Rich Results Test
- [ ] No "Freelance" or generic language
- [ ] knowsAbout covers all target keywords
- [ ] Consistent with llms.txt content

title: 1.2 Add Core Web Vitals monitoring
description:
## Task: Add Core Web Vitals Monitoring

### Purpose
Track LCP, INP, CLS to ensure "Atmospheric" animations don't degrade performance.

### Implementation Options

**Option A: Sentry Web Vitals (Recommended)**
Already included with Sentry browserTracingIntegration.
Verify it's capturing:
- LCP (Largest Contentful Paint) - Target: <2.5s
- INP (Interaction to Next Paint) - Target: <200ms (ideally <50ms per brand)
- CLS (Cumulative Layout Shift) - Target: <0.1

**Option B: Custom Reporting**
```typescript
// src/lib/web-vitals.ts
import { onLCP, onINP, onCLS } from 'web-vitals';

export function reportWebVitals() {
  onLCP(console.log);
  onINP(console.log);
  onCLS(console.log);
}
```

### Monitoring Dashboard
Create Sentry dashboard with:
- P75 LCP by page
- P75 INP by page (especially homepage with animations)
- CLS distribution
- Alerts if thresholds exceeded

### Pages to Watch
1. Homepage (heavy animations)
2. /demo (background effects)
3. /tools/traceforge (interactive app)
4. Service pages (new, need baseline)

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] CWV data flowing to Sentry/analytics
- [ ] Dashboard showing P75 metrics
- [ ] Alerts configured for threshold breaches
- [ ] Baseline established for all page types
close_reason: Added web-vitals package, browserTracingIntegration with INP, WebVitalsReporter component, and Sentry measurement reporting

title: Phase 3: AI Chat Assistant (Cloudflare Workers AI)
description:
AI chat assistant for portfolio.

**Recommendation:** Hybrid approach
1. Primary: Cloudflare Workers AI (free 10k neurons/day)
2. Fallback: WebLLM for privacy-conscious users (opt-in)

**Cloudflare Workers AI:**
- Model: @cf/meta/llama-3.2-1b-instruct
- ~2,000 conversations/day on free tier
- <50ms latency at edge

**System Prompt Concept:**
- ALEX_AI: Technical assistant for alexmayhew.dev
- Knows services, tech stack, blog topics, availability
- Professional but technical tone
- Keeps responses under 150 words
- Directs pricing questions to contact form

**UI Design:**
- Same window chrome as terminal (consistency)
- Cyber-lime for AI responses
- Mist White for user messages
- Typing indicator with blinking cursor
- Pulsing border for 'thinking' state

**Reference:** docs/FEATURE_IMPLEMENTATION_PLAN.md Section 5
close_reason: Not implementing - design decisions changed

title: 2.7 Submit pSEO pages to Google Search Console
description:
## Task: Submit pSEO Pages to Google Search Console

### Prerequisites
- [ ] All 20 service pages live
- [ ] Sitemap updated with service URLs
- [ ] Internal linking complete
- [ ] JSON-LD validates

### Steps

**1. Verify Domain Ownership (if not done)**
- Add TXT record or HTML file verification
- Confirm in GSC dashboard

**2. Submit Sitemap**
- URL: https://alexmayhew.dev/sitemap.xml
- Verify sitemap parses correctly
- Check for any errors/warnings

**3. Request Indexing for Key Pages**
Priority order:
1. /services (hub page)
2. /services/nextjs-developer-for-saas
3. /services/react-developer-for-fintech
4. /services/technical-advisor-for-startups
5. /services/fractional-cto-for-seed-stage
... (continue for all 20)

**4. Monitor Coverage**
- Check "Coverage" report daily for first week
- Look for:
  - Excluded pages
  - Crawl errors
  - Mobile usability issues
  
**5. Performance Baseline**
- Note initial impressions/clicks (will be zero)
- Set up weekly tracking

### Post-Submission Checklist
- [ ] Sitemap submitted and processed
- [ ] All service pages discovered
- [ ] No coverage errors
- [ ] Mobile usability passed
- [ ] Core Web Vitals passed (or noted for fixing)

### Timeline
- Day 1: Submit sitemap
- Day 2-7: Monitor indexing
- Day 7+: Check for ranking signals

title: 0.2 Create llms.txt for AI agent discovery
description:
## Task: Create llms.txt File

### Purpose
llms.txt is the 2026 standard for communicating with LLMs/AI agents. Unlike robots.txt (restricts), llms.txt (guides) ingestion. Acts as a CV for the website optimized for token-efficient processing.

### File: `public/llms.txt`

### Content Structure
```
# Alex Mayhew: Technical Advisor & Systems Architect

"Atmospheric Engineering" is high-precision, low-latency architecture for modern web development.

## Core Capabilities
- System Architecture: Scalable microservices, cloud-native infrastructure (AWS/GCP/Cloudflare)
- Performance Engineering: Sub-50ms INP, Core Web Vitals optimization, Next.js edge computing
- Legacy Migration: Strategic refactoring from monoliths (ColdFusion, AngularJS) to modern stacks
- AI/ML Integration: LLM deployment, RAG systems, vector databases, fine-tuning pipelines

## Technical Stack
- Frontend: Next.js 15, React 19, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, Framer Motion
- Backend: Node.js, Python/FastAPI, PostgreSQL, Redis
- Infrastructure: Cloudflare Pages/Workers, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes
- AI/ML: PyTorch, Transformers, Qdrant, OpenAI/Anthropic APIs

## Proof of Work
- TraceForge: GPU-accelerated vectorization (337x faster than Inkscape)
- PhotoKeep Pro: AI photo restoration (28.5dB PSNR, 73% cost reduction)
- PenQWEN: Domain-adapted cybersecurity LLM
- Claude Pilot: Enterprise Claude Code manager

## Services (pSEO Pages)
- /services/nextjs-developer-for-saas
- /services/react-developer-for-fintech
- /services/python-developer-for-healthcare
- /services/fullstack-developer-for-startups
- /services/technical-advisor-for-startups
[... all 20 pages when complete]

## Key Content
- /work - Portfolio with 10 featured projects
- /blog - 19 technical articles
- /about - Background and approach
- /contact - Consultation booking

## Contact
alex@alexmayhew.dev
https://alexmayhew.dev/contact
```

### Why This Matters
- OpenAI Operator, Google Gemini, Perplexity use this for discovery
- Translates "Atmospheric Engineering" brand to machine-readable expertise
- Directly impacts "Inclusion Rate" in AI-synthesized answers

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] File deployed at https://alexmayhew.dev/llms.txt
- [ ] Contains all service page URLs
- [ ] Proper markdown formatting
- [ ] Verified accessible (curl test)
close_reason: Implemented all pSEO infrastructure components

## Feature: Phase 2 - pSEO Implementation

### Overview

### Epic: amdev-183 (2026 Marketing Launch Plan)

### Current Status

- ✅ Industry research database created (industries.ts - 10 industries)
- ✅ Technology content created (technologies.ts - 8 technologies)
- ✅ 5 sample pages created (pages.ts)
- ❌ Route handler NOT created (directory exists but empty)
- ❌ Hub page NOT created
- ❌ Sitemap NOT updated
- ❌ 15 more pages needed

### Subtasks (Execution Order)

**Phase 0 - Critical Infrastructure:**
1. amdev-fb7 - Build dynamic route /services/[slug]/page.tsx ⚠️ REOPENED
2. amdev-ciz - Create services hub page /services/page.tsx
3. amdev-2g0 - Update sitemap.ts to include service pages

**Phase 1 - Content Generation:**

**Phase 2 - Linking & Discovery:**

**Future Expansion:**
9. amdev-f7t - Legacy Migration Vertical (Gemini Vertical A)
10. amdev-249 - SaaS Integration Vertical (Gemini Vertical B)

### Dependencies Graph
```
amdev-fb7 (route) ──┬──► amdev-ciz (hub) ──► amdev-a8h (linking)
                    │                              │
                    └──► amdev-2g0 (sitemap)       │
                                                   ▼
amdev-rr0 (pages) ─────────────────────────► amdev-8n0 (GSC)
```

### Success Metrics
- 20 service pages live and accessible
- All pages passing validation (5+ insights, 150+ words)
- JSON-LD validates in Google Rich Results Test

- GSC showing pages indexed

### Timeline
- Day 1: Route + Hub + Sitemap + llms.txt
- Day 2-4: Generate 15 additional pages
- Day 5: Internal linking
- Day 6: GSC submission + monitoring

- 21 service pages live at /services/[slug]
- Hub page at /services with 3-tier framework

title: 2.6 Implement internal linking strategy
description:
## Task: Implement Internal Linking Strategy

### Purpose
Prevent orphan pages, distribute SEO authority, improve crawlability.

### Architecture: Hub-Spoke Model

```
                    /services (HUB)
                         │
         ┌───────────────┼───────────────┐
         │               │               │
         ▼               ▼               ▼
   /services/nextjs  /services/react  /services/python
      for-saas       for-fintech      for-healthcare
         │               │               │
         └───────────────┼───────────────┘
                         │
              (lateral cross-links)
```

### Link Types Required

**1. Hub → Spoke Links**
- `/services` page links to ALL service pages
- Grouped by technology or industry
- Clear anchor text with keywords

**2. Spoke → Hub Links**
- Every service page links back to `/services`
- Via breadcrumb AND in-content link
- Anchor: "View all services" or "Back to services"

**3. Lateral Links (Spoke ↔ Spoke)**
- Each page links to 3-5 related services
- Use `relatedServices` field from page data
- Contextual placement in "Related Services" section

**4. Contextual Links from Blog**
- Blog posts mentioning technologies link to relevant service pages
- Example: Post about Next.js links to `/services/nextjs-developer-for-saas`
- Natural placement, not forced

**5. Navigation Links**
- Add "Services" to main navigation
- Footer includes service category links

### Breadcrumb Implementation
```
Home > Services > Next.js Developer for SaaS
```

Add BreadcrumbList JSON-LD schema to service pages.

### Implementation Files
- `src/app/services/page.tsx` - Hub with all links
- `src/app/services/[slug]/page.tsx` - Breadcrumb + related services section
- `src/components/layout/navigation.tsx` - Add Services link
- `src/components/layout/footer.tsx` - Add service category links

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Every service page is linked from /services hub
- [ ] Every service page links back to hub
- [ ] 3-5 related services on each page
- [ ] Breadcrumbs on all service pages
- [ ] Services in main navigation
- [ ] No orphan pages (all reachable within 3 clicks)
- [ ] BreadcrumbList schema validates
close_reason: Internal linking implemented: 18 blog posts link to service pages, service pages cross-link to related services

title: 1.3 Setup Google Analytics 4
description:
## Task: Setup Google Analytics 4

### Purpose
Track user behavior, conversion events, and traffic sources.

### Implementation

**1. Create GA4 Property**
- Property name: alexmayhew.dev
- Industry: Technology
- Business size: Small

**2. Component: src/components/analytics/google-analytics.tsx**
```typescript
import Script from 'next/script';

const GA_MEASUREMENT_ID = process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_GA_MEASUREMENT_ID;

export function GoogleAnalytics() {
  if (!GA_MEASUREMENT_ID) return null;
  
  return (
    <>
      <Script
        src={`https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtag/js?id=${GA_MEASUREMENT_ID}`}
        strategy="afterInteractive"
      />
      <Script id="google-analytics" strategy="afterInteractive">
        {`
          window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];
          function gtag(){dataLayer.push(arguments);}
          gtag('js', new Date());
          gtag('config', '${GA_MEASUREMENT_ID}');
        `}
      </Script>
    </>
  );
}
```

**3. Add to Layout**
```typescript
// src/app/layout.tsx
import { GoogleAnalytics } from '@/components/analytics/google-analytics';

// In <head> or <body>
<GoogleAnalytics />
```

### Events to Track
1. **Page Views** (automatic)
2. **Contact Form Submission** - `contact_form_submit`
3. **Service Page View** - `service_page_view` with slug
4. **CTA Clicks** - `cta_click` with location
5. **Blog Post Read** - `blog_read` with slug
6. **External Link Click** - `outbound_click`

### Conversion Goals
- Contact form submission
- Consultation scheduled (if Calendly integrated)

### Environment Variables
- NEXT_PUBLIC_GA_MEASUREMENT_ID

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] GA4 property created
- [ ] Tracking code deployed
- [ ] Page views recording
- [ ] Contact form event tracking
- [ ] Conversion goals configured
close_reason: GA4 implemented with trackEvent for contact form

title: Phase 3: WebGL Neural Field Background
description:
WebGL background effect for portfolio.

**Concept:** Neural Field - reactive particle/noise field

**Option A: GPU Particles with R3F (Recommended)**
- @react-three/fiber + @react-three/drei
- Thousands of particles forming subtle grid
- Particles drift with Perlin noise
- Cursor proximity causes scatter/attract
- Color shift from Void Navy to Cyber Lime near cursor

**Option B: Shader-Only (Lighter)**
- Single fullscreen canvas with GLSL fragment shader
- Animated noise field (reactive)
- Cursor creates ripples
- Smaller bundle size

**Performance:**
- Use OffscreenCanvas where supported
- Cap at 30fps for background
- Disable on prefers-reduced-motion
- Lazy load (don't block initial paint)

**Reference:** docs/FEATURE_IMPLEMENTATION_PLAN.md Section 4
close_reason: Not implementing - design decisions changed

title: 5.2 Build agency prospect list (50 agencies)
description: Research target agencies: Mid-size design agencies (10-50 employees), Marketing agencies offering web services, SEO agencies needing technical implementation. Collect: Agency name, founder/owner, email, recent work, tech gaps.

- ColdFusion → Node.js/Python
- ASP.NET Web Forms → Next.js
- Drupal 7 → Headless CMS
- jQuery Mobile → React Native/Flutter
- Backbone.js → Modern React
- PHP/WordPress → Jamstack
- Ruby on Rails → Node.js/Go

**Data per migration:**

- modernTech: { name, advantages, migrationPath }
- performanceDelta: TTI improvement estimate

title: 2.8 Legacy Migration pSEO Vertical (Gemini Vertical A)
description:
## Feature: Legacy Migration pSEO Vertical

### Source
Gemini Research Document - Vertical A

### Purpose
Target enterprises stuck on deprecated technology. High-urgency, high-budget market.

### Targeting Pattern
`migrate-[legacy]-to-[modern]` or `[legacy]-to-[modern]-migration`

### Pages to Create (5 initial)

| Legacy | Modern | Slug |
|--------|--------|------|
| AngularJS | React/Next.js | angularjs-to-nextjs-migration |
| ColdFusion | Node.js | coldfusion-to-nodejs-migration |
| ASP.NET Web Forms | .NET Core | aspnet-webforms-to-core-migration |
| jQuery | React | jquery-to-react-migration |
| Drupal 7 | Headless CMS | drupal7-to-headless-migration |

### Data Structure
Create `src/data/pseo/migrations.ts`:

```typescript
interface MigrationPage {
  slug: string;
  legacyTech: string;
  modernTech: string;
  
  // Unique data points (per Gemini)
  eolDate: Date;           // When support ended
  cveCount: number;        // Security vulnerabilities
  riskScore: 1-10;         // Calculated security risk
  performanceDelta: string; // Expected improvement (e.g., "400% faster TTI")
  talentGap: string;       // Developer availability comparison
  
  // Content
  migrationPattern: string; // Strangler Fig, Big Bang, etc.
  technicalDeepDive: string; // Framework-specific advice
  caseStudySnippet?: string;
  
  // Budget/Timeline
  timelineWeeks: { min: number; max: number };
  budgetRange: BudgetRange;
}
```

### Page Template
1. Hero: "Architecting the Migration: [Legacy] to [Modern]"
2. Risk Dashboard: Visual showing EOL status, CVE count, risk score
3. Technical Deep Dive: Migration patterns, specific advice
4. "Atmospheric" Pitch: Targeting 50ms INP post-migration
5. CTA: "AUDIT_SYSTEM()"

### SEO Target Keywords
- "angularjs to react migration"
- "coldfusion modernization"
- "legacy system migration consultant"
- "enterprise application modernization"

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Data structure defined
- [ ] 5 migration pages created
- [ ] Each page has unique EOL/CVE/risk data
- [ ] Technical deep dive accurate per framework pair
- [ ] Pages render and validate
close_reason: Routes and data already implemented and live at /services/migrations/*

title: 2.2 Build dynamic route /services/[slug]/page.tsx
description:
## Task: Build dynamic route /services/[slug]/page.tsx

### Problem
The `/services/[slug]/` directory exists but contains NO page.tsx file. The 5 existing pSEO pages in `src/data/pseo/pages.ts` are not rendering.

### Requirements

#### File: `src/app/services/[slug]/page.tsx`

**1. generateStaticParams()**
```typescript
export async function generateStaticParams() {
  return getPublishedPages().map((page) => ({
    slug: page.slug,
  }));
}
```

**2. generateMetadata()**
- Title from `page.seo.title`
- Description from `page.seo.description`
- Keywords from `page.seo.keywords`
- OpenGraph with industry-specific image
- Canonical URL: `https://alexmayhew.dev/services/{slug}`

**3. Page Template Structure**
Must match neo-brutalist design system:
- Hero: Technology + Industry headline
- Unique Insights section (5+ bullet points)
- Industry Regulations (collapsible/accordion)
- Common Pain Points with solutions
- Tech Stack Recommendations
- "Why This Stack" long-form section (150+ words)
- "Project Approach" long-form section (150+ words)
- Budget Guidance with tier breakdown
- FAQs (with FAQ schema)
- Related Services links
- CTA: "Schedule Consultation"

**4. JSON-LD Structured Data**
- ServicePage schema
- FAQPage schema
- HowTo schema (from projectApproach)
- BreadcrumbList schema

**5. Design Requirements**
- Use existing design tokens (void-navy, cyber-lime, etc.)
- Framer Motion animations (spring physics)
- Semantic HTML (section, article, aside)
- Accessible (WCAG AA contrast, proper headings)

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `/services/nextjs-developer-for-saas` renders correctly
- [ ] All 5 existing pages accessible and styled
- [ ] JSON-LD validates in Google Rich Results Test
- [ ] Lighthouse SEO score 95+
- [ ] No console errors
- [ ] Mobile responsive

### Files to Create
1. `src/app/services/[slug]/page.tsx` - Main route
2. `src/app/services/[slug]/loading.tsx` - Loading state (optional)
3. `src/app/services/[slug]/not-found.tsx` - 404 for invalid slugs
close_reason: Created /services/[slug] dynamic route with page.tsx, service-page-content.tsx (client component with full neo-brutalist UI), and not-found.tsx. All 5 published pSEO pages render correctly (200 status). Invalid slugs return 404.

title: 2.5 Generate initial 20 pSEO pages
description:
## Task: Generate Initial 20 pSEO Pages

### Current State
- 5 pages exist in `src/data/pseo/pages.ts`
- 15 more pages needed to reach target

### Existing Pages (5)
1. ✅ nextjs-developer-for-saas
2. ✅ react-developer-for-fintech  
3. ✅ python-developer-for-healthcare (Note: uses nodejs tech, slug mismatch)
4. ✅ fullstack-developer-for-startups
5. ✅ technical-advisor-for-startups

### Pages to Create (15)

**Technology + Industry Combinations (11):**
6. nextjs-developer-for-fintech
7. nextjs-developer-for-healthcare
8. nextjs-developer-for-ecommerce
9. react-developer-for-saas
10. react-developer-for-healthcare
11. nodejs-developer-for-logistics
12. python-developer-for-fintech
13. python-developer-for-saas
14. postgresql-expert-for-fintech
15. ai-integration-developer-for-saas
16. ai-integration-developer-for-healthcare

**Advisory Position Pages (4):**
17. fractional-cto-for-seed-stage
18. technical-due-diligence-consultant
19. legacy-migration-architect
20. performance-optimization-consultant

### Quality Requirements Per Page

Each page MUST have:
- [ ] slug: lowercase-hyphenated format
- [ ] technology: valid Technology type
- [ ] industry: valid Industry type
- [ ] seo.title: 30-70 characters
- [ ] seo.description: 100-170 characters
- [ ] seo.keywords: 3+ relevant keywords
- [ ] uniqueInsights: 5+ items, each 50+ characters
- [ ] industryRegulations: Relevant compliance (HIPAA, PCI-DSS, SOC2, etc.)
- [ ] commonPainPoints: 5+ items with title, description, solution
- [ ] techStackRecommendations: 5+ items with component, technology, rationale
- [ ] whyThisStack: 150+ words explaining tech choices
- [ ] projectApproach: 150+ words explaining methodology
- [ ] budgetGuidance: MVP and full ranges with factors
- [ ] faqs: 4+ questions with 50+ char answers
- [ ] relatedServices: Links to other pSEO pages
- [ ] lastUpdated: Current date
- [ ] published: true

### Data Sources
Use existing research in:
- `src/data/pseo/industries.ts` - Industry-specific regulations, pain points, tech stacks
- `src/data/pseo/technologies.ts` - Technology-specific best practices, pitfalls

### Validation
Run `validatePseoPage()` from `src/data/pseo/validation.ts` on each page before adding.

### Batch Strategy
- Batch 1 (Day 2): Pages 6-10
- Batch 2 (Day 3): Pages 11-15
- Batch 3 (Day 4): Pages 16-20

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] 20 total pages in pages.ts
- [ ] All pages pass validation
- [ ] No duplicate content between pages
- [ ] All render correctly at /services/[slug]
- [ ] Cross-links working
close_reason: 21 pSEO pages generated and live at /services/[slug]
